notes: Learn your class abilities from trainers in your starting zone.
Pick up your first profession(s) at level 5+ (e.g., Skinning + Leatherworking, Mining + Blacksmithing).
Start collecting linen cloth for First Aid.
At level 10, you can choose a talent specialization.
Consider joining a guild for social and leveling perks.
Start saving gold for your first mount at level 20 (costs ~4g with training).
Level 20: Apprentice Riding becomes available. Buy your first mount!
Keep professions up to date—especially gathering ones for gold income.
Visit your class trainer every 2 levels for new abilities.
Level 30: Journeyman Riding unlocks faster mounts (60% speed).
Consider running Scarlet Monastery for gear and XP.
Keep your First Aid skill high—Silk Cloth is abundant now.
Level 40: Expert Riding (100% ground mount speed) becomes available.
Start preparing for Mount Hyjal attunement if you plan to raid later.
Consider running Uldaman, Zul'Farrak, and Maraudon for gear and quests.
Level 50+: Class quests often unlock—check your trainer or capital city.
Save gold for flying training at level 60 (~600g total with mount).
Start preparing for Outland by finishing key quests in Blasted Lands.
Level 60: Flight training and Flying Mount available in Hellfire Peninsula.
Do the Ring of Blood questline in Nagrand for huge XP and a great weapon.
Level 68: You can head to Northrend early if desired.
Level 68: You can train Northrend professions in Valiance Keep (Alliance) or Warsong Hold (Horde).
Level 70: Expert Riding (150% flying) becomes available (~600g).
Level 77: Train Cold Weather Flying in Dalaran or K3 (~1,000g) to access Storm Peaks and Icecrown.
Do the Sons of Hodir questline in Storm Peaks for shoulder enchants.
Consider doing Argent Tournament dailies at level 77+ for gold and reputation.
